oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Work camps; Men; Equipment
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four men in a workshop for Civilian Conservation Corps Company 1475. They are using an assortment of tools and equipment.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back At Tennessee Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Civilian Conservation Corps Company 1475 started in Palmer, Tennessee, on June 22, 1933, but moved to Tracy City on June 29, 1935. It dug several lakes around Tracy City and worked to prevent and fight forest fires in Tracy City, Palmer, Monteagle, and Whitwell.
